item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 at 5:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (694 points | 173 comments)
2. AppleWatchAmmeter (126 points | 15 comments)
3. Scientists use magnetic nanotech to safely rewarm frozen tissues for transplant (23 points | 5 comments)
4. David Chang on the long, hard, stupid way (52 points | 18 comments)

6. RankScience (YC W17) is hiring to supercharge SEO for startups ( | hide)
7. OpenSSH Keystroke Obfuscation Bypass (70 points | 5 comments)
8. AWS AI Stack – Ready-to-Deploy Serverless AI App on AWS and Bedrock (21 points | 10 comments)
9. Research suggests more than half of VMware customers are looking to move (51 points | 16 comments)
10. The Golden Road: How Ancient India Transformed the World (47 points | 8 comments)
11. The magic of DC-DC voltage conversion (2023) (305 points | 86 comments)
12. How to make a table row a link (2020) (15 points | 6 comments)
13. Show HN: HypergraphZ – A Hypergraph Implementation in Zig (9 points | discuss)
14. Binsider – A TUI for analyzing Linux binaries (78 points | 19 comments)
15. How economical is your local Taco Bell? (206 points | 227 comments)
16. Soft Cells and the Geometry of Seashells (11 points | discuss)
17. Possibly all the ways to get loop-finding in graphs wrong (138 points | 29 comments)
18. Show HN: Clace – Application Server with support for scaling down to zero (22 points | 6 comments)
19. New Feature Alert: Access Archived Webpages Directly Through Google Search (29 points | 5 comments)
20. Google Illuminate: Books and papers turned into audio (605 points | 223 comments)
21. Ask HN: Why no transflective LCD portables? (41 points | 33 comments)
22. Ask HN: Why is Pave legal? (586 points | 210 comments)
23. Some of us like "interdiff" code review (167 points | 123 comments)
24. The Art of the Brew: Exploring Hops and Other Plant Ingredients That Define Beer (18 points | 4 comments)
25. Consent-O-Matic – automatically fills ubiquitous pop-ups with your preferences (215 points | 99 comments)
26. New York Times tech workers union votes to authorize a strike (412 points | 439 comments)
27. Device Tree Patches Posted for Review to Boot Linux on Apple A7 to A11 Devices (42 points | 6 comments)
28. Breaking Bell's Inequality with Monte Carlo Simulations in Python (73 points | 26 comments)
29. Openly Licensed Streetview with Panoramax (38 points | 9 comments)
30. Chai-1: Decoding the molecular interactions of life (256 points | 62 comments)
